column4: ok... it seems like apt is actually fine... i think the problem is with my root user o.o
NOTHING runs using sudo
no root? :|
the only, accept root ofcourse
can't su
su: Authentication failure
hmm... i've added myself to admin group or something like that via "users and groups" and apt-get works now...
looks like my groups were just messed up...
i've installed audacity, and it won't record anything... the playback is set to /dev/dsp, and i think it should be /dev/snd, but there is no way to change it... any idea what to do?
execute it with sudo first time then set it's input/output devices
no way to set it under sudo either
there's a package I think you may need, perhaps it's aoss
aoss didn't help... audacity still won't record
do you have the correct device selected for recording in your mixer?
where in my mixer? :P
double click the volume control icon
ok... now what?
depends on your sound-card, also, I use a different mixer than standard, can't reference easily, but select the recording device, and I suggest exploring a little :)
it's set to alsa, and microphone capture is enabled...
does Sound Recorder work properly?
nope... doesn't record either
there may be a microphone boost option somewhere in your mixer settings
still doesn't record... i hear the mic in my headphones, but when i record it has no sound...
some setups can be a bit temperamental, I use gnome-alsamixer, you may get better success using that to set things
